ConfigKey.description: Configuration key metadata for provider setup

default.description: Optional default value for the key

name.description: The name of the configuration key (e.g., "API_KEY")

oauth_flow.description:
Whether this key should be configured using OAuth device code flow
When true, the provider's configure_oauth() method will be called instead of prompting for manual input

required.description: Whether this key is required for the provider to function

secret.description: Whether this key should be stored securely (e.g., in keychain)

CspMetadata.description:
Content Security Policy metadata for MCP Apps
Specifies allowed domains for network connections and resource loading

connectDomains.description: Domains allowed for connect-src (fetch, XHR, WebSocket)

resourceDomains.description: Domains allowed for resource loading (scripts, styles, images, fonts, media)

additionalProperties.description: A map of environment variables to set, e.g. API_KEY -> some_secret, HOST -> host

oneOf.description: SSE transport is no longer supported - kept only for config file compatibility
Standard I/O client with command and arguments

name.description: The name used to identify this extension

oneOf.description: Built-in extension that is part of the bundled goose MCP server

name.description: The name used to identify this extension

oneOf.description: Platform extensions that have direct access to the agent etc and run in the agent process

name.description: The name used to identify this extension

oneOf.description: Streamable HTTP client with a URI endpoint using MCP Streamable HTTP specification

name.description: The name used to identify this extension

oneOf.description: Frontend-provided tools that will be called through the frontend

instructions.description: Instructions for how to use these tools

name.description: The name used to identify this extension

tools.description: The tools provided by the frontend

oneOf.description: Inline Python code that will be executed using uvx

dependencies.description: Python package dependencies required by this extension

name.description: The name used to identify this extension

ExtensionConfig.description: Represents the different types of MCP extensions that can be added to the manager

ExtensionData.description:
Extension data containing all extension states
Keys are in format "extension_name.version" (e.g., "todo.v0")

GooseApp.description: A Goose App combining MCP resource data with Goose-specific metadata

McpAppResource.description:
MCP App Resource
Represents a UI resource that can be rendered in an MCP App

description.description: Optional description of what this resource does

mimeType.description: MIME type (should be "text/html;profile=mcp-app" for MCP Apps)

text.description: Text content of the resource (HTML for MCP Apps)

uri.description: URI of the resource (must use ui:// scheme)

Message.description: A message to or from an LLM

MessageContent.description: Content passed inside a message, which can be both simple content and tool content

agentVisible.description: Whether the message should be included in the agent's context window

userVisible.description: Whether the message should be visible to the user in the UI

context_limit.description: The maximum context length this model supports

supports_cache_control.description: Whether this model supports cache control

PermissionLevel.description: Enum representing the possible permission levels for a tool.

ProviderMetadata.description: Metadata about a provider's configuration requirements and capabilities

allows_unlisted_models.description: Whether this provider allows entering model names not in the fetched list

default_model.description: The default/recommended model for this provider

display_name.description: Display name for the provider in UIs

known_models.description: A list of currently known models with their capabilities

model_doc_link.description: Link to the docs where models can be found

name.description: The unique identifier for this provider

RetryConfig.description: Configuration for retry logic in recipe execution

checks.description: List of success checks to validate recipe completion

max_retries.description: Maximum number of retry attempts before giving up

on_failure.description: Optional shell command to run on failure for cleanup

on_failure_timeout_seconds.description: Timeout in seconds for on_failure commands (default: 600 seconds)

timeout_seconds.description: Timeout in seconds for individual shell commands (default: 300 seconds)

sessions.description: List of available session information objects

oneOf.description: Execute a shell command and check its exit status

SuccessCheck.description: A single success check to validate recipe completion

Template.description: Information about a template including its content and customization status

ToolInfo.description: Information about the tool used for building prompts

domain.description: Preferred domain for the app (used for CORS)

prefersBorder.description: Whether the app prefers to have a border around it

name.description: Updated name for the session (max 200 characters)

userRecipeValues.description: Recipe parameter values entered by the user
